newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: KEPCO buys 748,000/T fuel oil from Yukong, Hanwha.
newsitem.headline: KEPCO buys 748,000/T fuel oil from Yukong, Hanwha.

text.p: The Korean Electric Power Corp (KEPCO) has awarded its term tender to buy 748,000 tonnes of low sulphur fuel oil for February to June delivery to South Korea's Yukong and Hanwha Energy, a KEPCO official said on Friday.
KEPCO bought the first batch of up to 75,000 tonnes of 0.3-percent sulphur fuel oil from Yukong at $45.90 per tonne premium to Singapore spot 180-centistoke quotes on a delivered and duty paid basis.
The first batch is for delivery in the first half of each month between February and June 1997

Hanwha Corp was awarded the second batch for similar volumes for delivery in the second half of every month between February and June. The awarded price was $34.95 per tonne over Singapore spot 180-centistoke quotes, cost-and-freight basis.
All cargoes are for delivery to Ulsan, the official said.
The tender was scheduled to be closed on December 20 with validity until December 23.
